solution_line_template: There are {total_devices}/{devices_per_package_40} = <<{total_devices}/{devices_per_package_40}={num_packages_40}>>{num_packages_40} sets of 5 devices in the school.

So the school will pay a total of ${cost_per_package_40} x {num_packages_40} = $<<{cost_per_package_40}*{num_packages_40}={total_cost_40}>>{total_cost_40} for the ${cost_per_package_40} software package.
There are {total_devices}/{devices_per_package_60} = <<{total_devices}/{devices_per_package_60}={num_packages_60}>>{num_packages_60} sets of 10 devices in the school.

So the school will pay a total of ${cost_per_package_60} x {num_packages_60} = $<<{cost_per_package_60}*{num_packages_60}={total_cost_60}>>{total_cost_60} for the ${cost_per_package_60} software package.

Thus, the school can save ${total_cost_40} - ${subtraction_value_in_solution} = $<<{total_cost_40}-{subtraction_value_in_solution}={savings}>>{savings} from buying the ${cost_per_package_60} software instead of the ${cost_per_package_40} software package.
